TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit TransformChain extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Defines an ordered list of objects that is applied to unsigned content prior to digest calculation.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.TransformChain> class contains a list of <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.Transform> objects that determine how to order XML data before creating a digest.
Use the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.TransformChain> class whenever you need to add one or more transform objects to an encrypted XML document or to a signed XML document.
Both the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.Reference> class and the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.EncryptedReference> class contain a <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.TransformChain> object. You can add a <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.Transform> object to the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.Reference> class by calling the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.Reference.AddTransform%2A> method. You can add a <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.Transform> object to the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.EncryptedReference> class by calling the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.EncryptedReference.AddTransform%2A> method. You can also create a <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.TransformChain> object manually and pass it to either the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.Reference.TransformChain%2A> property or the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.EncryptedReference.TransformChain%2A> property.
If you want to sign only a portion of an XML document, you can use a transform to identify the XML elements you intend to sign. Note that the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.Reference.Uri%2A> property and the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.EncryptedReference.Uri%2A> property automatically create internal transforms that allow you to sign a portion of a document.
For more information about transforms, see the XMLDSIG specification, which is available from the W3C at www.w3.org/TR/xmldsig-core/, or see the XML encryption specification, which is available from the W3C at www.w3.org/TR/xmlenc-core/.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Add(class System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.Transform transform) cil managed

Docs.param: The transform to add to the list of transforms.
Docs.summary: Adds a transform to the list of transforms to be applied to the unsigned content prior to digest calculation.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The transforms are applied to the unsigned content in the order in which they were added to the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.TransformChain> object.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Count As Integer
public: property int Count { int get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the number of transforms in the object.
Docs.value: The number of transforms in the object.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.Collections.IEnumerator GetEnumerator() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns an enumerator of the transforms in the object.
Docs.returns: An enumerator of the transforms in the object.

MemberSignature.Value: Default Public ReadOnly Property Item(index As Integer) As Transform

Docs.param: The index into the object that specifies which transform to return.
Docs.summary: Gets the transform at the specified index in the object.
Docs.value: The transform at the specified index in the object.
Docs.exception: The parameter is greater than the number of transforms.
